paint

Class PaintCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • paint.PaintCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class PaintCanvas
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    A canvas specially made for user drawing and image displaying. It provides tools for drawing various shapes using the mouse: lines, rectangles, squares, circles, a pen tool for free drawing and an eraser. It also allows to insert personalized text on the drawing. The PaintCanvas can open all of the most common image formats: Jpeg, PNG, Bitmap, GIF and can save in these formats as well. A selection tool allows parts of an image to be moved across the canvas. Drawing color, stroke width, text size can be changed. A color picker tool allows the drawing color to be changed according to a selected pixel in the image. Graphical User Interface for the PaintCanvas can be added by using a PaintToolbar.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PaintCanvas

        public PaintCanvas()
        Creates a new PaintCanvas pane. Default settings are applied and events are created to handle later modifications on the image.

      • PaintCanvas

        public PaintCanvas(double w,
                   double h)
        Creates a new PaintCanvas pane, with the provided width and height. Default settings are applied and events are created to handle later modifications on the image.
        Parameters:
        w - canvas' width
        h - canvas' height

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Erases the current content of the canvas to start a new drawing. All drawings on the canvas will be erased and the background set back to white. All modifications are removed from the drawing history, so no redo will be possible afterward. As well, whatever the selection rectangle contained will be discarded. The canvas will be resized to its default width and height.

      • reset

        public void reset(double w,
                  double h)
        Erases the current content of the canvas to start a new drawing. All drawings on the canvas will be erased and the background set back to white. All modifications are removed from the drawing history, so no redo will be possible afterward. As well, whatever the selection rectangle contained will be discarded. The canvas will be resized according to the specified width and height. Use when creating a new file.
        Parameters:
        w - canvas' new width.
        h - canvas' new height.

      • reset

        public void reset(double w,
                  double h,
                  javafx.scene.paint.Paint background)
        Erases the current content of the canvas and start anew drawing with the specified background paint. All drawings on the canvas will be erased and the new background will be added. All modifications are removed from the drawing history, so no redo will be possible afterward. As well, whatever the selection rectangle contained will be discarded. The canvas will be resized according to the specified width and height. Use when opening an existing image file, giving the ImagePaint as background paint.
        Parameters:
        w - canvas' new width.
        h - canvas' new height.
        background - the paint to use as a background to the new canvas.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color col)
        Sets the color used for drawings. This color will apply to all future shapes, free drawings and texts. This color will not apply to eraser and will not affect previous drawings.
        Parameters:
        col - new drawing color.

      • getColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getColor()
        Gets the color that is currently in use for drawings.
        Returns:
        Color the currently selected color.

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(double val)
        Sets the line stroke thickness used for drawings. This will apply to all future shapes and free drawings. Eraser tool will be set ten times this stroke thickness. This will not affect text size and will not apply to previous drawings.
        Parameters:
        val - new line width.

      • getLineWidth

        public double getLineWidth()
        Gets the line stroke thickness that is currently in use for drawings. This is the line width used when drawing shapes and free drawing. This is not the text size.
        Returns:
        double the current line width.

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(double val)
        Sets the font size to use for the text tool. This will only affect future texts and not the ones that are already on the image.
        Parameters:
        val - the new text size.

      • getFontSize

        public double getFontSize()
        Gets the font size that is currently in use for the text tool.
        Returns:
        double the font size

      • setPen

        public void setPen(PaintCanvas.Pen p)
        Sets the Pen to use for future drawing. The pen sets which type of shape to draw (line, rectangle, square, circle). It can also be set to hand drawing mode or text adding.
        Parameters:
        p - PaintCanvas.Pen corresponding to the desired shape or object to draw.

      • getPen

        public PaintCanvas.Pen getPen()
        Gets the Pen that is currently in use for drawings. The pen could be either drawing a shape (line, rectangle, square, circle), free drawing or text adding.
        Returns:
        PaintCanvas.Pen the currently used Pen.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(PaintCanvas.Mode m)
        Sets the interaction mode for the canvas. The mode can be either selecting parts of the image, eraser tool, dropper tool or regular drawing. If setting the mode to something else than selecting mode, the current selection will be printed to the current selection position. The selection rectangle will also erased and will disappear from the screen.
        Parameters:
        m - PaintCanvas.Mode corresponding to the desired mode.

      • getMode

        public PaintCanvas.Mode getMode()
        Gets the Mode that is currently in use. The mode can be either selecting parts of the image, eraser tool, dropper tool or regular drawing.
        Returns:
        PaintCanvas.Mode the currently selected mode

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Undoes the last action. Removes the last shape that was added to the children list. If the last action is a selection move, the selection will be removed from the canvas. The shape is saved in a stack and can be redrawn using Redo().

      • redo

        public void redo()
        Redoes the last undone action. Add the last undone shape to the children list if there is one available in undone action stack. It can be any drawing or the content from a selection. The shape is then popped out of the stack.

      • undoAvailable

        public boolean undoAvailable()
        Check if there is any action that could be undone. An action that can be undone is any previous shape drawing, free drawing, text adding, selection or selection move. Use to check if an action can be undone before calling Undo().
        Returns:
        true if undo is possible, false otherwise.

      • redoAvailable

        public boolean redoAvailable()
        Check if there is any action that could be redone. An action that can be redone is any previous shape drawing, free drawing, text adding, selection or selection move that has been canceled by calling Undo(). Use to check if an action can be redone before calling Redo().
        Returns:
        true if redo is possible, false otherwise.

      • hasChanged

        public boolean hasChanged()
        Checks if any modification has been added. This value is set to true whenever the content of the canvas changes. That means any shape drawing, free drawing, text adding, selection or selection moving. This value is reset to false as soon as the content of the canvas is saved by calling saveImageAs()
        Returns:
        true if the image has been modified since last save, false otherwise

      • openImageFromFile

        public void openImageFromFile(java.io.File file)
        Displays an image from a file inside the canvas. The file has to be an image file of any accepted format : Jpeg, PNG, GIF or Bitmap. The canvas will then be reset and the image will be open.
        Parameters:
        file - the file from which to get the image

      • saveImageAs

        public void saveImageAs(java.io.File file)
        Saves the canvas' content as an image in the provided file. The content will be saved as it is when calling this function. The selection will be removed if it has not been added to the content and the selection rectangle will be removed from the canvas.
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which to save the image
